definition: to share the bed/(fig.) to be married
like/same/similar/together/alike/with
(used in given names)/variant of 同[tong2]
see 衚衕|胡同[hu2 tong4]
bed/couch/classifier for beds/CL:張|张[zhang1]
variant of 床[chuang2]
common/general/to share/together/total/altogether/abbr. for 共產黨|共产党[Gong4 chan3 dang3], Communist party
pillow/to pillow/to rest one's head on (Taiwan pr. [zhen4] for this sense)

sentences.english: Do you keep your bed partner awake with the jerking movements of your legs?
sentences.chinese: 你是否因为你脚的抽搐导致同床共枕之人无法安眠？

sentences.english: We believe the promises of the woman who shares our bed.
sentences.chinese: 我们相信跟我们同床共枕的女人的诺言。

sentences.english: It's true that sleeping with a snorer can take a toll on your health.
sentences.chinese: 的确，与打鼾者同床共枕可以夺去你的健康。

sentences.english: I also missed sleeping with my wife.
sentences.chinese: 我怀念和妻子同床共枕的感觉。

sentences.english: Wealth and Content are not always Bed-fellows.
sentences.chinese: 财富和满足并非总是同床共枕。

sentences.english: Wang gave her a promise and then slept together with her.
sentences.chinese: 王生满口答应，就和她同床共枕。

sentences.english: In many cases, a person sharing the dreamer’s bed can be injured.
sentences.chinese: 大多数情况下，与做梦者同床共枕的人会受伤。
钱可以让陌生人同床共枕。

definition: lit. heads rubbing together (idiom)/fig. very close relationship
the person who shares your bed/partner/spouse
the pleasure of close intimacy in a couple (idiom)/sexual intercourse
(of a child bride) to consummate marriage
to have sexual intercourse
to live together
to go to bed/(coll.) to have sex
to have sexual relations with sb/to have dealings with
(coll.) to have sex
bridal room and ornamented candles/wedding festivities (idiom)
to have sexual intercourse (once)
to have cordial relations with each other/to have sexual intercourse
a single man and a single woman/bachelors/a man and a woman together (typically in a secluded setting)
illicit sexual relations
lit. to live and sleep together (idiom); fig. a close friendship
to make love
